short_text: The Surah takes its name from the word al-Haaqqah with which it opens.
text:
The Surah takes its name from the word al-Haaqqah with which it opens.

Period of Revelation

This too is one of the earliest surahs to be revealed at Makkah. Its subject matter shows that it was sent down at the time when opposition to the Holy Prophet (upon whom be peace) had started but had not yet become tyrannical. Musnad Ahmad contains a tradition from Hadrat Umar, saying: "Before embracing Islam one day I came out of my house with a view to causing trouble to the Holy Prophet, but he had entered the Masjid al-Haram before me. When I arrived I found that he was reciting surah Al-Haaqqah in the Prayer. I stood behind him and listened. As he recited the Qur'an I wondered at its literary charm and beauty. Then suddenly an idea came to my mind that he must be a poet as the Quraish alleged. Just at that moment he recited the words: "This is the Word of an honorable Messenger: it is not the word of a poet." I said to myself: Then, he must be a soothsayer, if not a poet. Thereupon be recited the words:"Nor is it the word of a soothsayer: little it is that you
reflect. It is a Revelation from the Lord and Sustainer of the worlds. On hearing this Islam entered deep into my heart." This tradition of Hadrat Umar shows that this surah had been sent down long before his acceptance of Islam, for even after this event he did not believe for a long time, and he continued to be influenced in favor of Islam by different incidents from time to time, till at last in the house of his own sister he came by the experience that made him surrender and submit to the Faith completely. (For details, see introduction to surah Maryam and Introduction to surah Al-Waqiah).

Theme and Subject Matter

The first section (vv. 1-37) is about the Hereafter and the second (vv. 38-52) about the Qur'an's being a revelation from Allah and the Holy Prophet's being a true Messenger of Allah.

The first section opens with the assertion that the coming of the Resurrection and the occurrence of the Hereafter is a truth which has to take place inevitably. Then in vv. 4-12, it has been stated that the communities that denied the Hereafter in the past became worthy of Allah's scourge ultimately. In vv. 13-17 the occurrence of Resurrection has been depicted. In vv. 18-37 the real object for which Allah has destined a second life for mankind after the present worldly life has been enunciated. In it we are told that on that Day all men shall appear in the Court of their Lord, where no secret of theirs shall remain hidden each man's record will be placed in his hand. Those who had spent lives in the world with the realization that one day they would have to render an account of their deeds before their Lord, and who had worked righteously in the world and provided beforehand for their well being in the Hereafter, will rejoice when they see that they have been acquitted and
blessed with the eternal bliss of Paradise. On the contrary, those who neither recognized the rights of Allah, nor discharged the rights of men, will have no one to save them from the punishment of Allah, and they will be cast into Hell.

In the second section (vv. 38-52) the disbelievers of Makkah have been addressed and told: "You think this Qur'an is the word of a poet or soothsayer, whereas it is a Revelation sent dawn by Allah, which is being presented by the noble Messengers. The Messenger by himself had no power to increase or decrease a word in it. If he forges something of his own composition into it, We will cut off his neck-vein (or heart- vein). For this is the Truth absolute and pure: and those who give it a lie, will have ultimately to regret and repent.
description: The surah that opens by proclaiming one of the names of the Day of Resurrection, The Inevitable reality or hour, so named because in the matter of truth shall forever be decided then and all truth shall prevail regarding every aair. It takes its name from the Inevitable or Besieger (al-Ḥāqqah) mentioned in verse 1. The surah describes punishment in this life (verse 4 .) and the next (verse 13 .). The bliss to be enjoyed by the believers is eloquently contrasted with the torments of hell (verse 19 .). From verse 38 onwards, God airms the Truth of the Quran and the Prophet.The surah is also known as: Reality, The Catastrophe, The Concrete Reality, The Indubitable, The Inevitable Hour, The Inevitable Reality, The Sure Occurrence, The Sure Reality, The Undeniable.

Efendi Nahi.verse 69:2: Cka është Casti i të vërtetës?
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:3: Kush ta shpjegon ty (plotësisht) Castin e të vërtetës (Kijametin)?
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:4: Themudi dhe Adi e kanë përgënjeshtruar Kijametin,
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:5: e populli i Themudit është shkatërruar me një ulurimë (britmë) të madhe temrruese,
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:6: e populli i Adit është shkatërruar me një furtunë të hatashme,
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:7: të cilën Perëndia ua ka dërguar atyre shtatë netë dhe tetë ditë – parreshtur, e ku mund t’i vërejshe njerëzit e përmbysur si trungjet e hurmeve të kalbura,
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:8: e, a po sheh mos ka mbetur kush prej tyre?
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:9: E, ka ardhur Faraoni, dhe ata para tij, si dhe populli (i Lutit), me gabime të mëdha
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:10: dhe e kundërshtuan të dërguarin e Zotit të tyre, andaj Perëndia i ka dënuar ata me dënim të ashpër.
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:11: Ne, kur vërshoi uji i madh, ju ngarkuam juve në anije,
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:12: për t’ju bërë këtë juve mësim dhe që të mbajnë mend veshët e atyre njerëzve (të dijshëm),
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:13: e kur të fryejë njëherë buria,
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:14: e toka dhe malet të bartën e të copëtohen nga një shpërthim (eksplodim)
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:15: atë ditë do të ngjajë Dita e Kijametit,
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:16: dhe do të çahet qielli, e atë ditë do të jetë i thyeshëm,
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:17: dhe engjëjt do të rrinë anëve të qiellit, kurse atë ditë – tetë grupe engjëjsh do ta mbajnë Arshin (fronin) e Zotit tënd.
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:18: Atë ditë do të pyeteni (paraqiteni) ju, dhe asnjë fshehtësi e juaj nuk do të mbetët e pazbuluar:
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:19: atij që i jepet libri i veprave të tij në dorën e djathtë, do t’ju thotë (të tjerëve): Qe, lexoni librin, tim;
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:20: unë kam qenë i bindur se do të paraqes llogari.
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:21: E, ai është në një jetë të këndshme,
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:23: frutet e të cilit janë të ulëta (afër duarve).
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:24: (Ju thuhet atyre): “Ju bafshin mirë ushqimi dhe pijet për veprat që keni punuar, në ditët e kaluara!”
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:25: Atij që i jepet libri i veprave të tij në dorën e majtë, do të thotë: “Ah, mos të më ishte dhënë libri im,
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:26: dhe mos të kisha ditur për llogarinë time,
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:27: Ah, të kisha qenë i vdekur (të mos isha ringjallur)!
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:28: Pasuria ime nuk më solli dobi,
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:30: (e atyre u thuhet): “Kapni ata dhe lidhni në pranga,
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:32: e mandej lidhni në zingjirë prej shtatëdhjetë kutësh,
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:33: sepse, ai, me të vërtetë, nuk ka besuar Perëndinë e Madhërueshëm,
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:34: dhe nuk ka nxitur të ushqejë të varfërit e shkretë.
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:35: Prandaj, ai, sot këtu, nuk ka mik të dashur,
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:37: të cilin e hanë vetëm fajtorët (jobesimtarët).
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:38: E, Unë betohem me atë çka shihni ju,
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:39: dhe me atë që nuk shihni,
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:40: me të vërtetë, ajo (Kur’ani) është fjala e shpallur Profetit të shenjtë,
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:41: e nuk është fjalë e poetit. Pak ju besoni,
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:42: e as nuk është fjalë e ndonjë magjistari (falltori), pak po mendoni ju!
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:43: (Kur’ani) është i zbritur nga Zotii gjithësisë!
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:44: Sikur të kishte trilluar (Muhammedi) diçka prej fjalëve në llogari Tonë,
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:45: Ne do ta kapnim atë ëpr dorën e djathtë,
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:46: dhe do t’ia prenim arterien e zemrës,
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:47: dhe askush prej jush nuk do të mund ta mbronte prej këtij (dënimi).
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:48: Me të vërtetë, ai (Kur’ani), është, këshillë për ata që dëshirojnë zbatimin e urdhërave dhe të ruhen prej të këqiave,
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:49: por, Ne, me siguri, e dimë, që ka prej jush përgënjeshtrues.
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:50: Me të vërtetë, ai (Kur’ani), është, fatkeqësi për mohuesit,
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:51: por, ai (Kur’ani), padyshim, është e vërtetë e pamohueshme.
Efendi Nahi.verse 69:52: Prandaj, falenderohu me emrin e Zotit tënd të Madhërueshëm.

null.verse 69:3: Nə bilirsən (haradan bilirsən) ki, nədir qiyamət?! (Qiyamətin nə olduğunu sənə nə öyrətdi?)
null.verse 69:4: Səmud da, Ad da (ürəkləri dəhşətə salan) o qiyaməti yalan saymışdılar!
null.verse 69:5: Səmud (qövmü) hədsiz dərəcədə dəhşətli (tükürpədici) səslə həlak edildi.
null.verse 69:6: Ad (qövmü) isə uğultulu, çox (soyuq və) siddətli bir küləklə tar-mar oldu.
null.verse 69:7: Allah o küləyi yeddi gecə, səkkiz gün ardı-arası kəsilmədən onların üstünə əsdirdi. Belə ki, (əgər yanlarında olsaydın) sən onları orada yıxılıb ölmüş görərdin. Onlar, sanki içi bomboş xurma kötükləri idilər.
null.verse 69:8: İndi sən onlardan heç bir əsər-əlamət görə bilərsənmi?!
null.verse 69:9: Fir'on da, ondan əvvəlkilər də, alt-üst olmuş Mö'təfikə əhli (Lut qövmü) də günah (xəta) törətmişdilər.
null.verse 69:10: Onlar Rəbbinin peyğəmbərinə asi olmuş, O da onları şiddəti getdikcə artan bir əzabla yaxalamışdı.
null.verse 69:11: Həqiqətən, hər tərəfi su basdığı zaman (Nuhun tufanı qopduqda) sizi gəmiyə Biz daşıdıq.
null.verse 69:12: Ona görə ki, bunu (mö'minlərə nicat verib kafirləri məhv etməyimizi) sizə bir ibrət dərsi edək və dərk edən (öyüd-nəsihəti cani-dildən dinləyən) qulaq bunu eşidib yadda saxlasın!
null.verse 69:13: Sur bircə dəfə üfürüləcəyi;
null.verse 69:14: Yer və dağlar qaldırılıb bircə dəfə bir-birinə çırpılacağı (əzilib toza dönəcəyi) zaman -
null.verse 69:15: Məhz o gün (vaqe olacağına heç bir şübhə olmayan) qiyamət qopacaqdır!
null.verse 69:16: Və (göy) süst düşüb parçalanacaqdır!
null.verse 69:17: Mələklər də onun (göyün) ətrafında (Allahın əmrinə müntəzir) olacaq və həmin gün (ya Peyğəmbər!) sənin Rəbbinin ərşini onların (başı) üstündə səkkiz mələk daşıyacaqdır!
null.verse 69:18: O gün (ey insanlar!) siz (haqq-hesab üçün Rəbbinizin hüzuruna) gətiriləcəksiniz. Sizin heç bir sirriniz (Allahdan) gizli qalmayacaqdır!
null.verse 69:19: Əməl dəftəri sağ əlinə verilən kimsə deyəcəkdir: "Alın, əməl dəftərimi oxuyun!
null.verse 69:20: Mən (dünyada ikən qiyamət günü) öz hesabıma yetişəcəyimə (möhkəm) inanmışdım!"
null.verse 69:21: Bundan belə o, xoş güzəran içində,
null.verse 69:23: (Elə bir Cənnət ki, onun) meyvələri çox yaxındadır (mö'minlər onlardan ayaq üstə olanda da, oturanda da, uzananda da yeyə biləcəklər).
null.verse 69:24: (Onlara belə deyiləcəkdir: ) "Keçmiş günlərdə etdiyiniz (yaxşı) əməllər müqabilində yeyin-için!"
null.verse 69:25: Əməl dəftəri sol əlinə verilən isə deyəcəkdir: "Kaş əməl dəftərim mənə verilməyəydi!
null.verse 69:26: Hesabımın nə olduğunu bilməyəydim!
null.verse 69:27: Kaş o (ölüm) qəti (əbədi) olaydı! (Bir daha dirilib bu əzabı görməyəydim!)
null.verse 69:28: Mal-dövlətim mənə heç bir fayda vermədi (Allahın əzabını məndən dəf edə bilmədi).
null.verse 69:29: Mülküm (səltənətim) də məhv olub getdi!"
null.verse 69:30: (Allah dərgahından belə bir nida gələcəkdir: ) "Onu tutub qandallayın!
null.verse 69:31: Sonra da Cəhənnəmə atın!
null.verse 69:32: Daha sonra onu yetmiş arşın uzunluğunda zəncirlə bağlayın!
null.verse 69:33: Cünki o, böyük olan Allaha inanmırdı.
null.verse 69:34: O (özü zəkat vermir, acizə, kimsəsizə kömək etmit, xalqda da) yoxsulu yedirtməyə rəğbət oyatmırdı.
null.verse 69:35: Bu gün bax burda onun yaxın bir dostu yoxdur.
null.verse 69:36: İrindən başqa bir yeməyi də yoxdur.
null.verse 69:37: Onu ancaq günahkarlar yeyər!"
null.verse 69:38: And içirəm gördüklərinizə,
null.verse 69:39: Və görmədiklərinizə ki,
null.verse 69:40: Bu (Qur'an) çox möhtərəm bir elçinin (Cəbrailin, yaxud Muhəmməd əleyhissəlamın Allahın ona nazil etdiyi) sözüdür!
null.verse 69:41: O, şair sözü deyildir! Nə az inanırsınız!
null.verse 69:42: O, kahin sözü də deyildir! Nə az düşünürsünüz!
null.verse 69:43: O, aləmlərin Rəbbi tərəfindən nazil edilmişdir.
null.verse 69:44: Əgər o (Peyğəmbər) özündən bə'zi sözlər uydurub Bizə isnad etsəydi,
null.verse 69:45: Biz ondan mütləq şiddətli intiqam alardıq (sağ əlini kəsərdik, yaxud boynunu vurardıq)!
null.verse 69:46: Sonra onun şah damarını qopardardıq!
null.verse 69:47: Və heç biriniz də (Bizim əzabımızı) ondan dəf edə bilməzdiniz.
null.verse 69:48: Şübhəsiz ki, bu (Qur'an) müttəqilərə bir öyüd-nəsihətdir.
null.verse 69:49: (Ey insanlar!) İçərinizdə onu yalan hesab edənlər olduğunu da, əlbəttə, bilirik.
null.verse 69:50: Şübhəsiz ki, bu (Qur'an) kafirlər üçün bir peşmançılıqdır (ona inanmadıqlarına görə qiyamət günü böyük zərər çəkəcəklər).
null.verse 69:51: Doğrudan da, bu (Qur'an) gerçək bir həqiqətdir.
null.verse 69:52: Elə isə (ya Peyğəmbər!) sən ulu olan Rəbbinin adını təsbih (müqəddəs tutub həmd-səna ilə zikr) et!

null.verse 69:3: i otkud ti znaš šta je Čas neizbježni?
null.verse 69:4: Semud i Ad su Smak svijeta poricali
null.verse 69:5: pa je Semud uništen glasom strahovitim,
null.verse 69:6: a Ad uništen vjetrom ledenim, silovitim,
null.verse 69:7: kome je On vlast nad njima, sedam noći i osam dana uzastopnih bio prepustio, pa si u njima ljude povaljane kao šuplja datulina debla vidio,
null.verse 69:8: i vidiš li da je iko od njih ostao?
null.verse 69:9: A došli su faraon, i oni prije njega,
null.verse 69:10: i protiv poslanika Gospodara svoga se dizali, pa ih je On ne može biti teže kaznio.
null.verse 69:11: Mi smo vas, kada je voda preplavila sve, u lađi nosili
null.verse 69:12: da vam to poukom učinimo i da to od zaborava sačuva uho koje pamti.
null.verse 69:13: A kada se jednom u Rog puhne,
null.verse 69:14: pa se Zemlja i nebo dignu i od jednog udara zdrobe,
null.verse 69:15: toga dana će se Smak svijeta dogoditi
null.verse 69:16: i nebo će se razdvojiti - tada će labavo biti -
null.verse 69:17: i meleki će na krajevima njegovim stajati, a prijesto Gospodara tvoga će tog dana iznad njih osmerica držati.
null.verse 69:18: Tada će ispitivani biti, i nijedna tajna vaša neće sakrivena ostati:
null.verse 69:19: onaj kome se knjiga njegova u desnu ruku njegovu da - reći će: "Evo vam, čitajte knjigu moju,
null.verse 69:20: ja sam čvrsto vjerovao da ću račun svoj polagati."
null.verse 69:21: I on će biti u životu zadovoljnom,
null.verse 69:23: čiji će plodovi na dohvat ruke biti.
null.verse 69:24: Jedite i pijte radosni, za ono što ste u danima minulim zaradili!
null.verse 69:25: A onaj kome se dâ knjiga u lijevu ruku njegovu reći će: "Kamo sreće da mi knjiga moja ni data nije
null.verse 69:26: i da ni saznao nisam za obračun svoj!
null.verse 69:27: Kamo sreće da me je smrt dokrajčila -
null.verse 69:28: bogatstvo moje mi nije od koristi,
null.verse 69:29: snage moje nema više!"
null.verse 69:30: Držite ga i u okove okujte,
null.verse 69:31: zatim ga samo u vatri pržite,
null.verse 69:32: a onda ga u sindžire sedamdeset lakata duge vežite,
null.verse 69:33: jer on u Allaha Velikog nije vjerovao
null.verse 69:34: i da se nahrani nevoljnik - nije nagovarao;
null.verse 69:35: zato on danas ovdje nema prisna prijatelja
null.verse 69:36: ni drugog jela osim pomija,
null.verse 69:37: koje će samo nevjernici jesti."
null.verse 69:38: A Ja se kunem onim što vidite
null.verse 69:39: i onim što ne vidite,
null.verse 69:40: Kur’an je, doista, govor objavljen plemenitom Poslaniku,
null.verse 69:41: a nije govor nikakva pjesnika - kako vi nikako ne vjerujete!
null.verse 69:42: i nisu riječi nikakva proroka - kako vi malo razmišljate!
null.verse 69:43: Objava je on od Gospodara svjetova!
null.verse 69:44: A da je on o Nama kojekakve riječi iznosio,
null.verse 69:45: Mi bismo ga za desnu ruku uhvatili,
null.verse 69:46: a onda mu žilu kucavicu presjekli,
null.verse 69:47: i niko ga između vas ne bi mogao od toga odbraniti.
null.verse 69:48: Pouka je Kur’an onima koju budu Allahova naređenja izvršavali, a zabrana se klonili -
null.verse 69:49: A Mi, sigurno, znamo da neki od vas neće u nj vjerovati -
null.verse 69:50: i on će biti uzrok jadu nevjernika,
null.verse 69:51: a on je, doista, sama istina
null.verse 69:52: zato ti hvali ime Gospodara tvoga, Veličanstvenoga!

null.verse 69:3: আপনি কি কিছু জানেন, সেই সুনিশ্চিত বিষয় কি?
null.verse 69:4: আদ ও সামুদ গোত্র মহাপ্রলয়কে মিথ্যা বলেছিল।
null.verse 69:5: অতঃপর সমুদ গোত্রকে ধ্বংস করা হয়েছিল এক প্রলয়ংকর বিপর্যয় দ্বারা।
null.verse 69:6: এবং আদ গোত্রকে ধ্বংস করা হয়েছিল এক প্রচন্ড ঝঞ্জাবায়ূ,
null.verse 69:7: যা তিনি প্রবাহিত করেছিলেন তাদের উপর সাত রাত্রি ও আট দিবস পর্যন্ত অবিরাম। আপনি তাদেরকে দেখতেন যে, তারা অসার খর্জুর কান্ডের ন্যায় ভূপাতিত হয়ে রয়েছে।
null.verse 69:8: আপনি তাদের কোন অস্তিত্ব দেখতে পান কি?
null.verse 69:9: ফেরাউন, তাঁর পূর্ববর্তীরা এবং উল্টে যাওয়া বস্তিবাসীরা গুরুতর পাপ করেছিল।
null.verse 69:10: তারা তাদের পালনকর্তার রসূলকে অমান্য করেছিল। ফলে তিনি তাদেরকে কঠোরহস্তে পাকড়াও করলেন।
null.verse 69:11: যখন জলোচ্ছ্বাস হয়েছিল, তখন আমি তোমাদেরকে চলন্ত নৌযানে আরোহণ করিয়েছিলাম।
null.verse 69:12: যাতে এ ঘটনা তোমাদের জন্যে স্মৃতির বিষয় এবং কান এটাকে উপদেশ গ্রহণের উপযোগী রূপে গ্রহণ করে।
null.verse 69:13: যখন শিংগায় ফুৎকার দেয়া হবে-একটি মাত্র ফুৎকার
null.verse 69:14: এবং পৃথিবী ও পর্বতমালা উত্তোলিত হবে ও চুর্ণ-বিচুর্ণ করে দেয়া হবে,
null.verse 69:15: সেদিন কেয়ামত সংঘটিত হবে।
null.verse 69:16: সেদিন আকাশ বিদীর্ণ হবে ও বিক্ষিপ্ত হবে।
null.verse 69:17: এবং ফেরেশতাগণ আকাশের প্রান্তদেশে থাকবে ও আট জন ফেরেশতা আপনার পালনকর্তার আরশকে তাদের উর্ধ্বে বহন করবে।
null.verse 69:18: সেদিন তোমাদেরকে উপস্থিত করা হবে। তোমাদের কোন কিছু গোপন থাকবে না।
null.verse 69:19: অতঃপর যার আমলনামা ডান হাতে দেয়া হবে, সে বলবেঃ নাও, তোমরাও আমলনামা পড়ে দেখ।
null.verse 69:20: আমি জানতাম যে, আমাকে হিসাবের সম্মুখীন হতে হবে।
null.verse 69:21: অতঃপর সে সুখী জীবন-যাপন করবে,
null.verse 69:23: তার ফলসমূহ অবনমিত থাকবে।
null.verse 69:24: বিগত দিনে তোমরা যা প্রেরণ করেছিলে, তার প্রতিদানে তোমরা খাও এবং পান কর তৃপ্তি সহকারে।
null.verse 69:25: যার আমলনামা তার বাম হাতে দেয়া হবে, সে বলবেঃ হায় আমায় যদি আমার আমল নামা না দেয়া হতো।
null.verse 69:26: আমি যদি না জানতাম আমার হিসাব!
null.verse 69:27: হায়, আমার মৃত্যুই যদি শেষ হত।
null.verse 69:28: আমার ধন-সম্পদ আমার কোন উপকারে আসল না।
null.verse 69:29: আমার ক্ষমতাও বরবাদ হয়ে গেল।
null.verse 69:30: ফেরেশতাদেরকে বলা হবেঃ ধর একে গলায় বেড়ি পড়িয়ে দাও,
null.verse 69:31: অতঃপর নিক্ষেপ কর জাহান্নামে।
null.verse 69:32: অতঃপর তাকে শৃঙ্খলিত কর সত্তর গজ দীর্ঘ এক শিকলে।
null.verse 69:33: নিশ্চয় সে মহান আল্লাহতে বিশ্বাসী ছিল না।
null.verse 69:34: এবং মিসকীনকে আহার্য দিতে উৎসাহিত করত না।
null.verse 69:35: অতএব, আজকের দিন এখানে তার কোন সুহূদ নাই।
null.verse 69:36: এবং কোন খাদ্য নাই, ক্ষত-নিঃসৃত পুঁজ ব্যতীত।
null.verse 69:37: গোনাহগার ব্যতীত কেউ এটা খাবে না।
null.verse 69:38: তোমরা যা দেখ, আমি তার শপথ করছি।
null.verse 69:39: এবং যা তোমরা দেখ না, তার-
null.verse 69:40: নিশ্চয়ই এই কোরআন একজন সম্মানিত রসূলের আনীত।
null.verse 69:41: এবং এটা কোন কবির কালাম নয়; তোমরা কমই বিশ্বাস কর।
null.verse 69:42: এবং এটা কোন অতীন্দ্রিয়বাদীর কথা নয়; তোমরা কমই অনুধাবন কর।
null.verse 69:43: এটা বিশ্বপালনকর্তার কাছ থেকে অবতীর্ণ।
null.verse 69:44: সে যদি আমার নামে কোন কথা রচনা করত,
null.verse 69:45: তবে আমি তার দক্ষিণ হস্ত ধরে ফেলতাম,
null.verse 69:46: অতঃপর কেটে দিতাম তার গ্রীবা।
null.verse 69:47: তোমাদের কেউ তাকে রক্ষা করতে পারতে না।
null.verse 69:48: এটা খোদাভীরুদের জন্যে অবশ্যই একটি উপদেশ।
null.verse 69:49: আমি জানি যে, তোমাদের মধ্যে কেউ কেউ মিথ্যারোপ করবে।
null.verse 69:50: নিশ্চয় এটা কাফেরদের জন্যে অনুতাপের কারণ।
null.verse 69:51: নিশ্চয় এটা নিশ্চিত সত্য।
null.verse 69:52: অতএব, আপনি আপনার মহান পালনকর্তার নামের পবিত্রতা বর্ননা করুন।

Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 69:3: И откъде да знаеш ти какво е Неизбежното?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 69:4: Самудяните и адитите взеха за лъжа Бедствието.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 69:6: А адитите бяха погубени от бушуващ леден вихър.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 69:7: Накара го Той да вилнее срещу тях седем нощи и осем дни поред, и виждаш там хората покосени, сякаш са стволове на повалени палми.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 69:8: И нима виждаш някой останал от тях?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 69:9: И Фараонът, и онези преди него, и сринатите [селища на Лут] вършеха грях.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 69:10: И се възпротивиха на пратеника от своя Господ, затова Той с мощ ги сграбчи.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 69:11: Когато водата преля, Ние ви понесохме в плаващия Ковчег,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 69:12: за да го сторим поука за вас и да го запомнят помнещи уши.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 69:13: И когато се протръби с Рога първия път,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 69:14: и бъдат вдигнати земята и планините, и бъдат натрошени с един удар,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 69:16: И ще се разцепи небето, и ще бъде слабо в този Ден.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 69:17: И ангелите ще са по краищата му. В този Ден осмина [от тях] ще носят Трона на твоя Господ.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 69:18: В този Ден ще бъдете изправени [пред Аллах]. Не ще бъде скрита и една ваша тайна.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 69:19: И онзи, чиято книга му се даде в десницата, ще каже: Ето ви, прочетете моята книга!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 69:20: Предполагах, че ще получа своята равносметка.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 69:24: Яжте и пийте със здраве за онова, което сте вършили преди, в отминалите дни!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 69:25: А онзи, чиято книга му се даде в левицата, ще каже: О, да не ми бе давана моята книга
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 69:26: и да не бях узнал каква е моята равносметка!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 69:27: О, да бе приключило всичко [със смъртта]!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 69:32: После го нанижете на верига, дълга седемдесет лакти!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 69:33: Не повярва той в Аллах, Превеликия.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 69:34: И не подканваше да бъде нахранен нуждаещият се,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 69:35: затова Днес няма тук за него ближен,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 69:36: нито храна освен кръв и гной.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 69:38: Ала не! Кълна се в това, което съзирате
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 69:39: и в това, което не съзирате,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 69:40: наистина то е слово на достоен Пратеник,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 69:41: а не е слово на поет. Но вие малко вярвате.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 69:42: И не е слово на гадател. Ала малко се поучавате.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 69:44: И ако той Ни приписваше някакви слова,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 69:45: щяхме да го сграбчим с Десницата,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 69:47: И никой сред вас не ще Ни възпре от това.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 69:49: И добре знаем, че сред вас има отричащи.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 69:52: Затова прославяй името на твоя Господ, Превеликия!

null.verse 69:3: 你怎麼能認識真災是什麼呢？
null.verse 69:4: 賽莫德人和阿德人，曾否認大難。
null.verse 69:5: 至於賽莫德人呢，已為嚴刑所毀滅；
null.verse 69:6: 至於阿德人，已為怒吼的暴風所毀滅。
null.verse 69:7: 真主曾使暴風對著他們連刮了七夜八晝，你看阿德人倒仆在地上，好像空心的海棗樹幹一樣。
null.verse 69:8: 你能看見他們還有孑遺嗎？
null.verse 69:9: 法老和在他之前的人，以及被傾覆的城市的居民，又再犯罪，
null.verse 69:10: 他們曾違抗他們的主的使者，故他嚴厲懲治了他們。
null.verse 69:11: 當大水泛濫的時候，我讓你們乘船，
null.verse 69:12: 以便我以那件事為你們的教訓，以便能記憶的耳朵把它記住。
null.verse 69:13: 當號角一嚮，
null.verse 69:14: 大地和山岳都被移動，且互相碰撞一次的時候；
null.verse 69:15: 在那日，那件大事將發生，
null.verse 69:16: 天將破裂；在那日，天將成為脆弱的。
null.verse 69:17: 眾天神將在天的各方；在那日，在他們上面，將有八個天神，擔負你的主的寶座；
null.verse 69:18: 在那日，你們將被檢閱，你們的任何秘密，都無法隱藏。
null.verse 69:19: 用右手接受自己的功過簿的人將說：「你們拿我的功過簿去讀讀吧！
null.verse 69:20: 我確已猜想到我必遇見我的賬目。」
null.verse 69:21: 他將在愉快的生活裡，
null.verse 69:23: 那裡面的水果伸手可得。
null.verse 69:24: 「你們可以愉快地飲食，因為你們在過去的歲月中行過善。」
null.verse 69:25: 以左手接過自己的功過簿的人將說：「啊呀！但願我沒有接過我的功過簿，
null.verse 69:26: 不知道我自己的賬目！
null.verse 69:27: 但願塵世的死亡已了結我的一生！
null.verse 69:28: 我的財產於我毫無裨益，
null.verse 69:29: 我的權柄已從我的手中消失。」
null.verse 69:30: 「你們捉住他，給他帶上枷鎖，
null.verse 69:31: 然後把他投在烈火裡，
null.verse 69:32: 然後把他穿在一條七十臂長的鏈子上。」
null.verse 69:33: 他生前確是不信仰尊大的真主，
null.verse 69:34: 不勉勵人賬濟貪民；
null.verse 69:35: 故今日他在這裡沒有一個親戚。
null.verse 69:36: 除膿汁外，他沒有食物。
null.verse 69:37: 只有迷誤的人們才吃膿汁。
null.verse 69:38: 不然！我以你們所能見的萬象盟誓，
null.verse 69:39: 並且以你們不能見的幽玄盟誓，
null.verse 69:40: 這確是尊貴的使者的言辭；
null.verse 69:41: 並不是詩人的言辭，你們很少信仰，
null.verse 69:42: 也不是僕人的言辭，你們很少覺悟。
null.verse 69:43: 這是從全世界的主降示的。
null.verse 69:44: 假若他假借我的名義，捏造謠言，
null.verse 69:45: 我必以權力逮捕他，
null.verse 69:46: 然後必割斷他的大動脈，
null.verse 69:47: 你們中沒有一個人能保衛他。
null.verse 69:48: 這確是對敬畏者的教訓。
null.verse 69:49: 我的確知道你們中有否認的人。
null.verse 69:50: 這對於不信道的人們確是悔恨。
null.verse 69:51: 這確是真實的信念，
null.verse 69:52: 故你當頌揚你的主的大名。

null.verse 69:3: Víš ty vůbec, co je to nevyhnutelná?
null.verse 69:4: Jak Thamúdovci, tak i ´Ádovci roztříšťující za lež pokládali.
null.verse 69:5: Co Thamúdovců se týče, ti byli ranou hromovou zahubeni,
null.verse 69:6: zatímco ´Ádovci byli vichřicí svištivou, nezkrotnou skoseni.
null.verse 69:7: Bůh dal jí, zničující, nad nimi vládu po osm dní a sedm nocí; a byl bys tam viděl lidi k zemi vržené, jako by to byly kmeny palem vykotlané.
null.verse 69:8: A vidíš snad, že by po nich bylo něco zůstalo?
null.verse 69:9: Též Faraón a ti, kdož před ním byli, i města vyvrácená se hříchy provinili
null.verse 69:10: a posla Pána svého neposlouchali, takže Bůh trestem nadměrným je uchvátil.
null.verse 69:11: A když se vodstva rozlila, na plující archu jsme vás přenesli,
null.verse 69:12: abychom ji pro vás připomenutím učinili a aby uši pozorné to podržely.
null.verse 69:13: Až bude zatroubeno na pozoun jedním zatroubením
null.verse 69:14: a země a hory budou zvednuty a rozdrceny úderem jedním,
null.verse 69:15: v ten den nezvratná dopadne
null.verse 69:16: a nebe se rozpoltí a bude zející toho dne
null.verse 69:17: a stát budou andělé na krajích jeho; v ten den osm jich nad sebou ponese trůn Pána tvého.
null.verse 69:18: V ten den předvedeni budete a nezůstane u vás skryto nic tajného.
null.verse 69:19: A komu bude dána kniha jeho do pravice, ten řekne: "Zde přečtěte si knihu mou!
null.verse 69:20: Já soudil jsem vždy, že s účtem svým se setkám jednou."
null.verse 69:21: A takový bude mít žití příjemné
null.verse 69:23: jejíž plody na dosah budou.
null.verse 69:24: Jezte a pijte v bezpečí za to, co jste již vykonali v době minulé!
null.verse 69:25: A komu bude dána kniha jeho do levice, ten řekne: "Ach, kéž by mi nebyla dána kniha má
null.verse 69:26: a já se nikdy nedozvěděl účtu svého výsledek!
null.verse 69:27: Ach, kéž by tato smrt byla konečná!
null.verse 69:28: K ničemu dnes mi není můj majetek
null.verse 69:29: a zanikla, daleko ode mne, pravomoc má!"
null.verse 69:30: Chopte se ho a v řetězy jej zakovejte,
null.verse 69:31: pak v ohni pekelném jej palte
null.verse 69:32: a potom řetězem sedmdesát loktů dlouhým jej svažte!"
null.verse 69:33: On věru nevěřil v Boha mocného
null.verse 69:34: a nevybízel k nakrmení nuzného,
null.verse 69:35: takže zde nemá dnes druha vřelého
null.verse 69:36: ani krom splašek pokrmu jiného,
null.verse 69:37: jež jísti budou jen těžcí hříšníci.
null.verse 69:38: Hle, já přísahám při tom, co vidíte,
null.verse 69:39: i při tom, co nezříte,
null.verse 69:40: že toto zajisté je řeč posla vznešeného!
null.verse 69:41: Nejsou to slova básníkova - jak málo vy věříte -
null.verse 69:42: ani řeč věštcova - jak krátkou paměť máte -
null.verse 69:43: leč je to od Pána lidstva seslání!
null.verse 69:44: A kdyby si on proti vůli Naší vymýšlel nějaká rčení,
null.verse 69:45: věru bychom jej vzali za jeho pravici
null.verse 69:46: a pak mu prořízli jeho srdečnici
null.verse 69:47: a žádný z vás by tomu nemohl zabránit.
null.verse 69:48: Korán vskutku je připomenutí bohabojným
null.verse 69:49: a dobře víme, že mezi vámi jsou ti, kdo nazývají jej vylhaným.
null.verse 69:50: A věru on zármutku nevěřících je příčinou
null.verse 69:51: a vskutku je pravdou jistotnou!
null.verse 69:52: Chval tedy jméno Pána svého mocného!

null.verse 69:2: Wat is het dat plaats zal hebben?
null.verse 69:3: Gij weet niet wat plaats zal hebben.
null.verse 69:4: De Samoed alsook de Aad loochenden de ramp.
null.verse 69:5: Wat de Samoed betreft, dezen werden door een overweldigende straf vernietigd.
null.verse 69:6: En de Aad werden door een felle, geweldige wind vernietigd.
null.verse 69:7: Die Hij zeven nachten en acht dagen achtereenvolgens over hen liet woeden, zodat gij hadt kunnen zien hoe het volk er door neergeworpen werd, alsof zij gevallen palmboomstammen waren.
null.verse 69:8: Kunt gij enige overblijfselen van hen vinden?
null.verse 69:9: Ook Pharao, en degenen die vóór hem waren, en de steden die verwoest werden begingen grote zonde;
null.verse 69:10: En zij gehoorzaamden de boodschapper van hun Heer niet, daarom greep Hij hen met een vaste greep.
null.verse 69:11: Ziet, toen de wateren stegen, droegen Wij u de ark binnen,
null.verse 69:12: Opdat Wij dit tot een les voor u mochten maken en opdat degene die deze (gebeurtenis) kan onthouden zich deze moge herinneren.
null.verse 69:13: En wanneer een enkele stoot op de bazuin zal worden geblazen,
null.verse 69:14: En de aarde en de bergen van hun plaats zullen worden opgeheven en terstond zullen worden verbrijzeld,
null.verse 69:15: Op die Dag zal de grote gebeurtenis plaats vinden.
null.verse 69:16: En de hemelen zullen uiteen splijten, zodat deze op die Dag zwak zullen zijn.
null.verse 69:17: En de engelen zullen op de zijden ervan staan. En op die Dag zullen acht engelen de troon van uw Heer boven zich houden.
null.verse 69:18: Dan zult gij worden bloot gelegd en geen uwer geheimen zal verborgen blijven.
null.verse 69:19: En hij, aan wie zijn boek in de rechter hand wordt gegeven, zal zeggen: "Komt, leest mijn boek.
null.verse 69:20: Voorzeker, ik wist dat ik mijn afrekening tegemoet moest gaan."
null.verse 69:21: Deze zal dan een heerlijk leven krijgen
null.verse 69:23: Waarvan het fruit gemakkeljik bereikbaar zal zijn.
null.verse 69:24: "Eet en drinkt smakelijk als loon voor hetgeen gij in vroeger dagen hebt gedaan."
null.verse 69:25: Maar, hij wiens boek in de linker hand wordt gegeven, zal zeggen: "O was mijn boek mij maar niet gegeven!
null.verse 69:26: En had ik maar niet geweten wat mijn oordeel was!
null.verse 69:27: O, had de dood maar aan mij een einde gemaakt!
null.verse 69:28: Mijn rijkdom heeft mij niet gebaat,
null.verse 69:29: Mijn macht is van mij weg gegaan."
null.verse 69:30: Grijpt hem en boeit hem.
null.verse 69:31: Werpt hem dan in de hel.
null.verse 69:32: Bindt hem vervolgens met een ketting vast waarvan de lengte zeventig armlengten bedraagt;
null.verse 69:33: Want hij geloofde niet in God, de Grote.
null.verse 69:34: Noch moedigde hij aan, de armen te spijzigen.
null.verse 69:35: Daarom heeft hij hier geen vriend;
null.verse 69:36: Noch voedsel, behalve spoelsel van wonden,
null.verse 69:37: Dat niemand dan de zondaren zal gebruiken.
null.verse 69:38: Neen, Ik zweer bij alles wat gij ziet,
null.verse 69:39: En bij alles wat gij niet ziet,
null.verse 69:40: Dit is voorzeker de boodschap die een eerwaardige boodschapper heeft gebracht.
null.verse 69:41: Het is geen woord van een dichter; nietig is hetgeen gij gelooft.
null.verse 69:42: Noch is het de uiting van een waarzegger; gering is de lering, die gij er uit trekt.
null.verse 69:43: Het is een Openbaring van de Heer der werelden.
null.verse 69:44: En indien hij enige woorden in Onze naam had uitgedacht,
null.verse 69:45: Dan zouden Wij hem zeker bij de rechter hand hebben gegrepen.
null.verse 69:46: En daarna zijn levensader hebben afgesneden,
null.verse 69:47: En geen uwer zou ons van hem hebben kunnen tegenhouden.
null.verse 69:48: Voorwaar, het is een vermaning voor de godvrezenden.
null.verse 69:49: En voorzeker, Wij weten dat er onder u loochenaars zijn.
null.verse 69:50: Waarlijk, de ongelovigen zullen er wroeging over hebben.
null.verse 69:51: En voorwaar, het is de ware zekerheid.
null.verse 69:52: Verheerlijk daarom de naam van uw Heer, de Luisterrijke.

Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:3: Ah, what will convey unto thee what the reality is!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:4: (The tribes of) Thamud and A’ad disbelieved in the judgment to come.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:5: As for Thamud, they were destroyed by the lightning.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:6: And as for A’ad, they were destroyed by a fierce roaring wind,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:7: Which He imposed on them for seven long nights and eight long days so that thou mightest have seen men lying overthrown, as they were hollow trunks of palm-trees.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:8: Canst thou (O Muhammad) see any remnant of them ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:9: And Pharaoh and those before him, and the communities that were destroyed, brought error,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:10: And they disobeyed the messenger of their Lord, therefor did He grip them with a tightening grip.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:11: Lo! when the waters rose, We carried you upon the ship
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:12: That We might make it a memorial for you, and that remembering ears (that heard the story) might remember.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:13: And when the trumpet shall sound one blast
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:14: And the earth with the mountains shall be lifted up and crushed with one crash,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:15: Then, on that day will the Event befall.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:16: And the heaven will split asunder, for that day it will be frail.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:17: And the angels will be on the sides thereof, and eight will uphold the Throne of thy Lord that day, above them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:18: On that day ye will be exposed; not a secret of you will be hidden.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:19: Then, as for him who is given his record in his right hand, he will say: Take, read my book!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:20: Surely I knew that I should have to meet my reckoning.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:21: Then he will be in blissful state
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:23: Whereof the clusters are in easy reach.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:24: (And it will be said unto those therein): Eat and drink at ease for that which ye sent on before you in past days.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:25: But as for him who is given his record in his left hand, he will say: Oh, would that I had not been given my book
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:26: And knew not what my reckoning!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:27: Oh, would that it had been death!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:28: My wealth hath not availed me,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:29: My power hath gone from me.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:30: (It will be said): Take him and fetter him
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:31: And then expose him to hell-fire
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:32: And then insert him in a chain whereof the length is seventy cubits.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:33: Lo! He used not to believe in Allah the Tremendous,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:34: And urged not on the feeding of the wretched.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:35: Therefor hath he no lover here this day,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:38: But nay! I swear by all that ye see
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:39: And all that ye see not
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:40: That it is indeed the speech of an illustrious messenger.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:41: It is not poet’s speech - little is it that ye believe!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:42: Nor diviner’s speech - little is it that ye remember!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:43: It is a revelation from the Lord of the Worlds.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:44: And if he had invented false sayings concerning Us,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:45: We assuredly had taken him by the right hand
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:47: And not one of you could have held Us off from him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:48: And lo! it is a warrant unto those who ward off (evil).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:49: And lo! We know that some among you will deny (it).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:50: And lo! it is indeed an anguish for the disbelievers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:51: And lo! it is absolute truth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 69:52: So glorify the name of thy Tremendous Lord.

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:3: And what will make thee realise what the Sure Reality is?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:4: The Thamud and the ’Ad People (branded) as false the Stunning Calamity!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:5: But the Thamud,- they were destroyed by a terrible Storm of thunder and lightning!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:6: And the ’Ad, they were destroyed by a furious Wind, exceedingly violent;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:7: He made it rage against them seven nights and eight days in succession: so that thou couldst see the (whole) people lying prostrate in its (path), as they had been roots of hollow palm-trees tumbled down!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:8: Then seest thou any of them left surviving?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:9: And Pharaoh, and those before him, and the Cities Overthrown, committed habitual Sin.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:10: And disobeyed (each) the apostle of their Lord; so He punished them with an abundant Penalty.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:11: We, when the water (of Noah’s Flood) overflowed beyond its limits, carried you (mankind), in the floating (Ark),
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:12: That We might make it a Message unto you, and that ears (that should hear the tale and) retain its memory should bear its (lessons) in remembrance.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:13: Then, when one blast is sounded on the Trumpet,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:14: And the earth is moved, and its mountains, and they are crushed to powder at one stroke,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:15: On that Day shall the (Great) Event come to pass.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:16: And the sky will be rent asunder, for it will that Day be flimsy,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:17: And the angels will be on its sides, and eight will, that Day, bear the Throne of thy Lord above them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:18: That Day shall ye be brought to Judgment: not an act of yours that ye hide will be hidden.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:19: Then he that will be given his Record in his right hand will say: "Ah here! Read ye my Record!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:20: "I did really understand that my Account would (One Day) reach me!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:21: And he will be in a life of Bliss,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:23: The Fruits whereof (will hang in bunches) low and near.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:24: "Eat ye and drink ye, with full satisfaction; because of the (good) that ye sent before you, in the days that are gone!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:25: And he that will be given his Record in his left hand, will say: "Ah! Would that my Record had not been given to me!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:26: "And that I had never realised how my account (stood)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:27: "Ah! Would that (Death) had made an end of me!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:28: "Of no profit to me has been my wealth!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:30: (The stern command will say): "Seize ye him, and bind ye him,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:31: "And burn ye him in the Blazing Fire.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:32: "Further, make him march in a chain, whereof the length is seventy cubits!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:33: "This was he that would not believe in God Most High.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:34: "And would not encourage the feeding of the indigent!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:35: "So no friend hath he here this Day.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:36: "Nor hath he any food except the corruption from the washing of wounds,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:37: "Which none do eat but those in sin."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:38: So I do call to witness what ye see,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:40: That this is verily the word of an honoured apostle;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:41: It is not the word of a poet: little it is ye believe!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:42: Nor is it the word of a soothsayer: little admonition it is ye receive.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:43: (This is) a Message sent down from the Lord of the Worlds.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:44: And if the apostle were to invent any sayings in Our name,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:45: We should certainly seize him by his right hand,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:46: And We should certainly then cut off the artery of his heart:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:47: Nor could any of you withhold him (from Our wrath).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:48: But verily this is a Message for the God-fearing.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:49: And We certainly know that there are amongst you those that reject (it).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:50: But truly (Revelation) is a cause of sorrow for the Unbelievers.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:51: But verily it is Truth of assured certainty.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 69:52: So glorify the name of thy Lord Most High.

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:3: And what will teach thee what is the Indubitable?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:4: Thamood and Ad cried lies to the Clatterer.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:5: As for Thamood, they were destroyed by the Screamer;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:6: and as for Ad, they were destroyed by a wind clamorous,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:7: violent that He compelled against them seven nights and eight days, uninterruptedly, and thou mightest see the people laid prostrate in it as if they were the stumps of fallen down palm-trees.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:8: Now dost thou see any remnant of them?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:9: Pharaoh likewise, and those before him, and the Subverted Cities -- they committed error,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:10: and they rebelled against the Messenger of their Lord, and He seized them with a surpassing grip.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:11: Lo, when the waters rose, We bore you in the running ship
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:12: that We might make it a reminder for you and for heeding ears to hold.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:13: So, when the Trumpet is blown with a single blast
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:14: and the earth and the mountains are lifted up and crushed with a single blow,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:15: then, on that day, the Terror shall come to pass,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:16: and heaven shall be split, for upon that day it shall be very frail,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:17: and the angels shall stand upon its borders, and upon that day eight shall carry above them the Throne of thy Lord.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:18: On that day you shall be exposed, not one secret of yours concealed.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:19: Then as for him who is given his book in his right hand, he shall say, ’Here, take and read my book!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:20: Certainly I thought that I should encounter my reckoning.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:21: So he shall be in a pleasing life
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:24: ’Eat and drink with wholesome appetite for that you did long ago, in the days gone by.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:25: But as for him who is given his book in his left hand, he shall say, ’Would that I had not been given my book
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:27: Would it had been the end!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:28: My wealth has not availed me,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:29: my authority is gone from me.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:31: and then roast him in Hell,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:32: then in a chain of seventy cubits’ length insert him!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:33: Behold, he never believed in God the All-mighty,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:34: and he never urged the feeding of the needy;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:35: therefore he today has not here one loyal friend,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:36: neither any food saving foul pus,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:37: that none excepting the sinners eat.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:38: No! I swear by that you see
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:39: and by that you do not see,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:40: it is the speech of a noble Messenger.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:41: It is not the speech of a poet (little do you believe)
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:42: nor the speech of a soothsayer (little do you remember).
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:43: A sending down from the Lord of all Being.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:44: Had he invented against Us any sayings,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:45: We would have seized him by the right hand,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:46: then We would surely have cut his life-vein
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:47: and not one of you could have defended him.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:48: Surely it is a Reminder to the godfearing;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:49: but We know that some of you will cry lies.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:50: Surely it is a sorrow to the unbelievers;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:51: yet indeed it is the truth of certainty.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 69:52: Then magnify the Name of thy Lord, the All-mighty.

Muhammad Asad.verse 69:1: OH, THE LAYING-BARE of the truth!
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:2: How awesome that laying-bare of the truth!
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:3: And what could make thee conceive what that laying-bare of the truth will be?
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:4: THE LIE gave [the tribes of] Thamūd and ’ād to [all tidings of] that sudden calamity!
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:5: Now as for the Thamūd – they were destroyed by a violent upheaval [of the earth];
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:6: and as for the ’ād – they were destroyed by a stormwind furiously raging,
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:7: which He willed against them for seven nights and eight days without cease, so that in the end thou couldst see those people laid low [in death], as though they were so many [uprooted] trunks of hollow palm trees:
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:8: and dost thou now see any remnant of them?
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:9: And there was Pharaoh, too, and [many of] those who lived before him, and the cities that were overthrown – [all of them] indulged in sin upon sin
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:10: and rebelled against their Sustainer’s apostles: and so He took them to task with a punishing grasp exceedingly severe!
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:11: [And] behold: when the waters [of Noah’s flood] burst beyond all limits, it was We who caused you to be borne [to safety] in that floating ark,
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:12: so that We might make all this a [lasting] reminder to you all, and that every wide-awake ear might consciously take it in.
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:13: Hence, [bethink yourselves of the Last Hour,] when the trumpet [of judgment] shall be sounded with a single blast,
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:14: and the earth and the mountains shall be lifted up and crushed with a single stroke!
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:15: And so, that which must come to pass will on that Day have come to pass;
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:16: and the sky will be rent asunder – for frail will it have become on that Day
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:17: and the angels [will appear] at its ends, and, above them, eight will bear aloft on that Day the throne of thy Sustainer’s almightiness....
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:18: On that Day you shall be brought to judgment: not [even] the most hidden of your deeds will remain hidden.
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:19: Now as for him whose record shall be placed in his right hand, he will exclaim: "Come you all! Read this my record!
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:20: Behold, I did know that [one day] I would have to face my account!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:21: And so he will find himself in a happy state of life,
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:23: with its fruits within easy reach.
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:24: [And all who are thus blest will be told:] "Eat and drink with good cheer in return for all [the good deeds] that you have sent ahead in days gone by!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:25: But as for him whose record shall be placed in his left hand, he will exclaim: "Oh, would that I had never been shown this my record,
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:26: and neither known this my account!
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:27: Oh, would that this [death of mine] had been the end of me!
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:28: Of no avail to me is all that I have [ever] possessed,
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:29: [and] all my power of argument has died away from me!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:30: [Thereupon the command will go forth:] "Lay hold of him, and shackle him,
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:31: and then let him enter hell,
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:32: and then thrust him into a chain [of other sinners like him – a chain] the length whereof is seventy cubits:
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:33: for, behold, he did not believe in God, the Tremendous,
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:34: and did not feel any urge to feed the needy:
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:35: and so, no friend has he here today,
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:36: nor any food save the filth
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:37: which none but the sinners eat!
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:38: BUT NAY! I call to witness all that you can see,
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:39: as well as all that you cannot see!
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:40: Behold, this [Qur’ān] is indeed the [inspired] word of a noble apostle,
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:41: and is not – however little you may [be prepared to] believe it – the word of a poet;
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:42: and neither is it – however little you may [be prepared to] take it to heart – the word of a soothsayer:
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:43: [it is] a revelation from the Sustainer of all the worlds.
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:44: Now if he [whom We have entrusted with it] had dared to attribute some [of his own] sayings unto Us,
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:45: We would indeed have seized him by his right hand,
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:46: and would indeed have cut his life-vein,
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:47: and none of you could have saved him!
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:48: And, verily, this [Qur’ān] is a reminder to all the God-conscious.
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:49: And, behold, well do We know that among you are such as will give the lie to it:
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:50: yet, behold, this [rejection] will indeed become a source of bitter regret for all who deny the truth [of God’s revelation]
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:51: for, verily, it is truth absolute!
Muhammad Asad.verse 69:52: Extol, then, the limitless glory of thy Sustainer’s mighty name!

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:3: And what can let you know what the Imminent happening is?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:4: Thamūd and ‘Ād had denied (the happening of) the Shocking Event (the Day of Judgment).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:5: As for Thamūd, they were destroyed by that (dreadful cry), which exceeded all limits.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:6: And as for ‘Ād, they were destroyed by a violent windstorm
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:7: that He imposed on them for seven nights and eight consecutive days; so you could see them thrown on the ground, as if they were trunks of hollow palm-trees.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:8: Now, do you see any remnant of them?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:9: And Fir‘aun (Pharaoh) and those before him and the overthrown towns came up with evil,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:10: and they disobeyed the messenger of their Lord, so He seized them with an extremely severe seizure.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:11: When the water overflowed (in the Deluge of NūH), We let you (O mankind,) board the floating ship,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:12: so that We make it a reminder for you, and so that a preserving ear (that hears their story) may preserve it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:13: Then, once the Trumpet will be blown for the first time,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:14: and the earth and the mountains will be lifted and crushed into pieces with a single blow,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:15: then on that Day the Happening will happen,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:16: and the sky will burst apart, while it will have become frail on that day.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:17: And the angels will be on its borders. And on that Day, the Throne of your Lord will be carried above them by eight (angels).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:18: On that day, you will be brought forward in a way that no secret of yours will remain secret.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:19: Now, as for him who is given his book in his right hand, he will say (to his colleagues), “Come here, read my book.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:20: I was sure that I would encounter my reckoning.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:21: So he will be in a well-pleasing life
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:23: the fruits of which will be close at hand.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:24: (It will be said to such people,) “Eat and drink with pleasure, as a reward for what you did in advance during past days.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:25: As for him who will be given his book in his left hand, he will say, “ Oh, would that I had not been given my book,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:26: and I had never known what my account is!
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:27: Oh, would that it (death) had been the end of the matter!
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:28: My wealth has not been of any use to me.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:29: My power has gone from me for good.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:30: (Then it will be said to angels,) “Seize him, then put a collar around his neck,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:31: and then, let him burn in the blazing fire.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:32: Thereafter, fasten him with a chain the measure of which is seventy hands.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:33: Indeed, he did not believe in Allah, the Almighty,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:34: and did not persuade (others) to feed the needy.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:35: So, he has no friend here today,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:36: nor any food except that which comes out from wounds when washing,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:37: which is eaten by none but the sinners.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:38: I swear by what you see,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:39: and what you do not see,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:40: it is surely the speech of a noble Messenger, (that he conveys from Allah).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:41: and it is not the speech of a poet, (but) little you believe,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:42: nor is it the speech of a soothsayer, (but) little you heed to the advice.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:43: It is a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:44: Had he (the prophet) forged some statements in Our name,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:45: We would have certainly seized him by the right hand,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:47: and none of you could have saved him from it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:48: It is infact a Reminder for the God-fearing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:49: And, of course, We know that among you there are deniers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:50: And surely, it is a cause of remorse for the disbelievers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:51: And it is surely an absolute truth.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 69:52: So, pronounce the purity of the name of your magnificent Lord.

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:3: And how would you know what the Reality is?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:5: As for Thamūd, they were destroyed by the [overwhelming] Roar.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:6: And as for ‘ād, they were destroyed by a deafening violent wind.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:7: He forced it upon them for seven nights and eight days, successively, so that you might have seen the people therein lying prostrate, as if they were the hollow trunks of palm-trees.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:8: So do you see any remnant of them?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:9: And Pharaoh and those of his followers and the Deviant [cities] brought iniquity.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:10: Then they disobeyed the messenger of their Lord, so He seized them with a devastating blow.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:11: Truly when the waters rose high, We carried you in the sailing vessel,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:12: so that We might make it a reminder for you and that receptive ears might remember it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:13: Thus when the Trumpet is blown with a single blast,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:14: and the earth and the mountains are lifted and levelled with a single levelling,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:15: then, on that day, the [imminent] Event will come to pass,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:16: and the heaven will be rent asunder — for it will be very frail on that day —
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:17: and the angels will be [all] over its borders, and above them — on that day eight will carry the Throne of your Lord.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:18: On that day you will be exposed. No hidden thing of yours will remain hidden.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:19: As for him who is given his book in his right hand, he will say: ‘Here, read my book!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:20: I was truly certain that I would encounter my account’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:21: So he will enjoy a pleasant living,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:23: whose clusters are in easy reach.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:24: ‘Eat and drink in enjoyment for what you did in advance in former days’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:25: But as for him who is given his book in his left hand, he will say, ‘O would that I had not been given my book,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:26: and not known what my account were!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:27: O would that it had been the [final] end.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:28: My wealth has not availed me.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:29: My authority has gone from me’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:32: then in a chain whose length is seventy cubits insert him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:33: Lo! he never believed in God the Tremendous,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:34: and never urged the feeding of the needy;
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:35: therefore here today he has no [loyal] friend,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:37: which none shall eat but the sinners’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:38: So indeed I swear by all that you see,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:39: and all that you do not see
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:40: it is indeed the speech of a noble messenger.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:41: And it is not the speech of a poet. Little do you believe!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:42: Nor [is it] the speech of a soothsayer. Little do you remember!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:43: A revelation from the Lord of the Worlds.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:44: And had he fabricated any lies against Us,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:45: We would have assuredly seized him by the Right Hand,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:46: then We would have assuredly severed his life-artery,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:47: and not one of you could have defended him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:48: And assuredly it is a reminder for the God-fearing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:49: And assuredly We know that some of you are deniers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:50: And assuredly it is a [cause of] anguish for the disbelievers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:51: And assuredly it is the certain truth.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 69:52: So glorify the Name of your Lord, the Tremendous.

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:2: What is the surely Inevitable Hour?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:3: And what has made you alert what (calamity) surely is the Inevitable Hour?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:4: Thamud and ‘Ad rejected the (calamity of a) Shattering Gravitational Collision (of all the existent cosmic bodies).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:5: So, as for the people of Thamud, they were destroyed by the extremely violent, Deafening Blast.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:6: And as for the people of ‘Ad, they (too) were destroyed by a violently cold, roaring gale.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:7: Allah made that (gale) seize them for consecutive seven nights and eight days. So, you could see them lying dead (during that time as if) they were hollow roots of the uprooted palm trees.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:8: So do you see any of them surviving?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:9: And Pharaoh and those before him and (the dwellers of) the overthrown towns (of the community of Lut [Lot]) committed grave sins.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:10: So they (also) disobeyed the Messenger of their Lord. And Allah seized them with a mighty seizure.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:11: Indeed, when the water (of the Deluge) overflowed the limit, We carried you in the floating Ark,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:12: So that We make this (episode a reminding) lesson of warning for you and that the retentive ears may retain it.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:13: Then when the Trumpet will be blown once,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:14: And the earth and mountains will be removed (from their places), they will then be crushed to sand particles in a single crash.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:15: Then that will be the Hour when the surely Inevitable (calamity) will occur.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:16: And (all) the heavenly bodies will split apart and this universe will come to comprise (black) holes (by means of a force which coordinates and keeps the system going).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:17: And the angels will be standing on its edges and above them that Day, and eight (angels or parties of angels) will be carrying the Throne of your Lord.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:18: That Day you will be made to appear (for reckoning). Nothing of your secrets will remain hidden.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:19: So the one who will be given his record in the right hand will say (pleased): ‘Come and read my record.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:20: I firmly believed that I would find my account (easy).’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:21: So he will live a pleasant life,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:23: The clusters of its fruits hanging low (due to abundance).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:24: (It will be said to them:) ‘Eat and drink rejoicing, in recompense of (your deeds) that you had sent forward during the days of your past (life).’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:25: And as for him who will be given his record in his left hand, he will say: ‘Would that I had not been given my record!
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:26: And would that I had not known about my account!
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:27: Alas! Would that (death) had settled my affair once and for all!
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:28: Today my wealth has not been able to keep (the torment) away from me even a little.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:29: My power and domain have (also) gone from me.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:30: (It will be commanded:) ‘Seize him and put him in neck-fetter.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:32: Then bind him tightly in a seventy yard long chain.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:33: Verily, he did not believe in Allah, the Lord of Majesty.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:34: Nor did he urge the feeding of the poor.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:35: So Today he does not have any warm friend.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:36: Nor has he anything to eat except filthy pus,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:37: That no one will eat except the sinners.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:38: So I swear by the things that you see,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:39: And by those things that you do not see.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:40: Assuredly, this (Qur’an) is the (God-sent) commandment of the Exalted and Glorious Messenger ([blessings and peace be upon him] which he expounds as a Messenger and as a Vicegerent).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:41: And it is not the poetry of a poet (composed with literary expertise). You have but little faith.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:42: Nor is it the word of a fortune-teller (designed by skilful guesswork). You take but little advice.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:43: (This) is sent down by the Lord of all the worlds.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:44: And had he ascribed to Us even a (single) fabricated thing,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:45: We would have seized him with full force and might,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:46: Then certainly We would have cut his life artery,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:47: Then no one of you could have held (Us) back from it.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:48: So no doubt this (Qur’an) is direction and guidance for the Godfearing.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:49: And surely, We know that some of you are the beliers (of this open truth).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:50: And surely, this is (a cause of) bitter regret for the disbelievers.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:51: And undeniably, it is the truth of Absolute Certitude.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 69:52: So, (O Esteemed Beloved,) glorify your Lord, Most Magnificent, with persistence.

null.verse 69:3: Ja miten saisi sinut käsittämään, mikä varma tuho on?
null.verse 69:4: Tamuud ja Aad väittivät, ettei tuomiopäivää tule.
null.verse 69:5: Tamuudin kansan tuhosi ärjyvä ukonilma,
null.verse 69:6: Aadin tuhosi raivoisa tuuli, joka puhalsi tavattomalla voimalla;
null.verse 69:7: se raivosi heidän keskuudessaan seitsemän yötä ja seitsemän päivää suurella voimalla, niin että olisit voinut nähdä ihmisten kaatuvan maahan kuin palmujen ontot rungot.
null.verse 69:8: Näetkö heistä jälkeäkään?
null.verse 69:9: Farao ja ne, jotka elivät ennen häntä, sekä hävitetyt kaupungit tekivät myös syntiä
null.verse 69:10: ollen tottelemattomia Herransa sananjulistajalle; siksi Hän kuritti heitä väkevin ottein.
null.verse 69:11: Kun vesi tulvi, Me totisesti annoimme laivan kantaa teitä,
null.verse 69:12: teille ojennukseksi ja jotta kuunteleva korva vaarin ottaisi ja muistaisi sen.
null.verse 69:13: Kun, puhalletaan yhden ainoan kerran pasuunaan
null.verse 69:14: ja maa sekä vuoret kohoavat ja sitten yht'äkkiä vaipuvat murskattuina alas,
null.verse 69:15: sinä päivänä on suuri tuho tapahtuva,
null.verse 69:16: taivas repeää; sinä päivänä se syöksyy alas.
null.verse 69:17: Enkeleitä on oleva ylt'ympäri, ja kahdeksan heistä kantaa yläpuolellaan Herrasi valtaistuinta.
null.verse 69:18: Sinä päivänä teidät tuodaan oikeuden eteen, ja yksikään salaisuutenne ei voi jäädä kätköön.
null.verse 69:19: Se, jolle kirja on annettu hänen oikeaan käteensä, sanoo: »Tulkaa ja lukekaa kirjani!
null.verse 69:20: Totisesti uskon, että koittaa tilinteon päivä.»
null.verse 69:21: Ja hän on saava mieluisan elämän,
null.verse 69:23: jossa hedelmät ovat käden ulottuvilla.
null.verse 69:24: »Syökää ja juokaa mielenne mukaan palkaksi siitä, mitä olette tehneet menneinä päivinä!»
null.verse 69:25: Ja hän, jolle kirja on annettu vasempaan käteen, sanoo: »Oi, jospa en olisi kirjaani milloinkaan saanut,
null.verse 69:26: ja jospa en olisi koskaan joutunut kokemaan, mitä tilinteko on!
null.verse 69:27: Oi, jospa kuolema olisi ollut kaiken loppu!
null.verse 69:28: Rikkauteni ei minua lainkaan hyödytä,
null.verse 69:29: valtani on minulta häipynyt.»
null.verse 69:30: »Ottakaa hänet, sitokaa hänet
null.verse 69:31: ja heittäkää sitten helvettiin!
null.verse 69:32: Kytkekää hänet kahleisiin, joiden pituus on seitsemänkymmentä kyynärää!
null.verse 69:33: Totisesti, hän ei uskonut Jumalaan, suureen,
null.verse 69:34: eikä kehoittanut ravitsemaan köyhiä;
null.verse 69:35: sentähden hänellä ei ole yhtään ystävää tuona päivänä
null.verse 69:36: eikä muuta ruokaa kuin likavesi,
null.verse 69:37: jota vain jumalattomat nielevät.»
null.verse 69:38: Mutta ei! Vannon kaiken sen nimessä, mitä näette
null.verse 69:39: ja mitä eivät silmänne näe:
null.verse 69:40: Totisesti, se on kunnioitettavan sananjulistajan sana
null.verse 69:41: eikä mitään runoilijan puhetta - vähän te uskotte -
null.verse 69:42: ei se liioin ole mitään ennustelijan puhetta - vähän te käsitätte -
null.verse 69:43: se on ilmoitus Jumalalta, maailman Herralta.
null.verse 69:44: Ja jos profeetta olisi sepitellyt runoja Meistä,
null.verse 69:45: olisimme totisesti tarttunut häntä oikeaan käteen
null.verse 69:46: ja katkaissut häneltä suuren valtasuonen,
null.verse 69:47: teidän kenenkään voimatta Meitä siitä estää.
null.verse 69:48: Tämä on totisesti muistutus niille, jotka karttavat pahaa.
null.verse 69:49: Ja Me totisesti tiedämme, että joukossanne on sellaisia, jotka julistavat totuuden valheeksi,
null.verse 69:50: ja totisesti tuleva tuomio on surkea asia epäuskoisille,
null.verse 69:51: mutta se on totisesti varma todellisuus.
null.verse 69:52: Ylistä siis Herrasi, suuren, nimeä!

Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:3: Qu'est-ce qui te fera connaître ce qu'est l'Inéluctable ?
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:4: Les Thamoud et les 'Ad ont traité de mensonge le grand coup.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:5: Pour les Thamoud, ils ont été détruits par la foudre.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:6: Quand aux 'Ad, ils ont été détruits par un vent mugissant et impétueux
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:7: que Dieu a fait souffler contre eux durant sept nuits et huit jours sans discontinuer. Alors, tu aurais pu voir ces gens couchés à terre comme des troncs de palmiers évidés.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:8: Peux-tu en voir qui auraient subsisté ?
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:9: Pharaon, ceux qui vécurent avant lui et les cités renversées commirent des fautes :
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:10: ils désobéirent au prophète de leur Seigneur, et Celui-ci les saisit avec une force irrésistible.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:11: Mais Nous, lorsque l'eau déborda, Nous vous portâmes sur le vaisseau,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:12: afin d'en faire pour vous un rappel et pour qu'une oreille attentive le retienne.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:13: Lorsqu'on sonnera une seule fois la trompette,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:14: lorsque la terre et les montagnes seront emportées et pulvérisées d'un seul coup,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:16: le ciel se fendra et, ce Jour-là, il sera fragile.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:17: Les anges se tiendront sur ses confins et, ce Jour-là, huit d'entre eux porteront au-dessus d'eux le trône de ton Seigneur.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:18: Ce Jour-là, vous serez exposés sans qu'aucun de vos secrets reste caché.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:19: Celui qui recevra son livre dans la main droite dira : " Tenez, lisez mon livre !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:20: Je pensais bien que j'aurais à rendre compte ! ",
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:23: dont les fruits seront à portée de main.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:24: " Mangez et buvez heureux, en récompense de ce que vous avez accompli durant les jours passés ".
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:25: Quant à celui qui recevra son livre dans la main gauche, il dira : " Malheur à moi !...Puissé-je ne pas avoir reçu mon livre
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:26: et ne pas connaître mon compte !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:27: Malheur à moi pour ce qui m'échoit !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:28: Ma fortune ne m'a servi à rien
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:32: et, ensuite, liez-le avec une chaîne de soixante-dix coudées ".
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:33: Il ne croyait pas en Dieu le Magnifique,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:34: il n'encourageait pas à nourrir le pauvre.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:35: Aujourd'hui, il ne lui reste aucun ami dévoué,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:36: ni d'autre nourriture qu'un aliment fétide
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:37: dont seuls les pécheurs se nourrissent.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:38: Ainsi donc, J'en jure par ce que vous voyez
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:39: et par ce que vous ne voyez pas :
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:40: c'est là, en vérité, la parole d'un noble Envoyé,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:41: ce n'est pas la parole d'un poète ; comme votre foi est faible !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:42: ce n'est pas non plus la parole d'un devin ; comme vous réfléchissez peu !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:43: c'est une révélation du Seigneur des mondes !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:44: S'il avait inventé contre Nous quelques paroles mensongères,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:45: Nous l'aurions pris par la main droite,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:46: puis Nous lui aurions tranché l'aorte
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:47: et nul d'entre vous n'aurait pu s'y opposer.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:48: C'est là un rappel pour ceux qui craignent Dieu,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:49: mais Nous savons que certains d'entre vous crient au mensonge !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:50: C'est là un sujet de lamentation pour les mécréants !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:51: C'est là la Vérité et la certitude absolue !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 69:52: Glorifie le Nom de ton Seigneur, le Magnifique !

Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:3: Et qui te dira ce que c’est que l’inévitable ?
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:4: Les Tamud et les Aad avaient traité de mensonge le cataclysme.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:5: Quant aux Tamud, ils furent détruits par le [bruit] excessivement fort.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:6: Et quant aux Aad, ils furent détruits par un vent mugissant et furieux
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:7: qu’ [Dieu] déchaîna contre eux pendant sept nuits et huit jours consécutifs; tu voyais alors les gens renversés par terre comme des souches de palmiers évidées.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:9: Pharaon et ceux qui vécurent avant lui ainsi que les Villes renversées commirent des fautes .
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:10: Ils désobéirent au Messager de leur Seigneur. Celui-ci donc, les saisit d’une façon irrésistible.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:11: C’est Nous qui, quand l’eau déborda , vous avons chargés sur l’Arche
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:12: afin d’en faire pour vous un rappel que toute oreille fidèle conserve.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:13: Puis, quand d’un seul souffle, on soufflera dans la Trompe,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:14: et que la terre et les montagnes seront soulevées puis tassées d’un seul coup;
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:15: Ce jour-là alors, l’événement se produira,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:16: et le ciel se fendra et sera fragile, ce jour-là.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:17: Et sur ses côtés [se tiendront] les Anges, tandis que huit, ce jour-là, porteront au-dessus d’eux le Trône de ton Seigneur.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:18: Ce jour-là vous serez exposés; et rien de vous ne sera caché.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:19: Quant à celui à qui on aura remis le Livre en sa main droite, il dira : «Tenez ! lisez mon livre.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:20: J’étais sûr d’y trouver mon compte».
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:23: dont les fruits sont à portées de la main.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:24: «Mangez et buvez agréablement pour ce que vous avez avancé dans les jours passés».
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:25: Quant à celui à qui on aura remis le Livre en sa main gauche, il dira : «Hélas pour moi ! J’aurai souhaité qu’on ne m’ait pas remis mon livre,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:26: et ne pas avoir connu mon compte...
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:27: Hélas, comme j’aurais souhaité que [ma première mort] fût la définitive.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:28: Ma fortune ne ma servi à rien.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:29: Mon autorité est anéantie et m’a quitté ! ».
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:32: puis, liez-le avec une chaîne de soixante-dix coudées,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:33: car il ne croyait pas en Dieu, le Très Grand.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:34: et n’incitait pas à nourrir le pauvre.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:35: Il n’a pour lui ici, aujourd’hui, point d’ami chaleureux [pour le protéger],
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:36: ni d’autre nourriture que du pus,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:38: Mais non... Je jure par ce que vous voyez,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:39: ainsi que par ce que vous ne voyez pas,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:40: que ceci [le Coran] est la parole d’un noble Messager ,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:41: et que ce n’est pas la parole d’un poète; mais vous ne croyez que très peu,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:42: ni la parole d’un devin, mais vous vous rappelez bien peu.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:43: C’est une révélation du Seigneur de l’Univers.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:44: Et s’il avait forgé quelques paroles qu’ils Nous avait attribuées,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:45: Nous l’aurions saisi de la main droite,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:46: ensuite, Nous lui aurions tranché l’aorte.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:47: Et nul d’entre vous n’aurait pu lui servir de rempart.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:48: C’est en vérité un rappel pour les pieux.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:49: Et Nous savons qu’il y a parmi vous qui le traitent de menteur;
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:50: mais en vérité, ce sera un sujet de regret pour les mécréants,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 69:52: Glorifie donc le nom de ton Seigneur, le Très Grand !

null.verse 69:3: Wie kannst du wissen, was das Unvermeidliche ist?
null.verse 69:4: Die Thamüd sowohl wie die Àd glaubten nicht an das dräuende Unheil.
null.verse 69:5: Dann, was die Thamüd anlangt, so wurden sie durch einen fürchterlichen Schall vernichtet.
null.verse 69:6: Und was die Àd anlangt, so wurden sie durch einen gewaltigen Sturmwind vernichtet,
null.verse 69:7: Den Er sieben Nächte und acht Tage lang ununterbrochen gegen sie wüten ließ, so daß du das Volk niedergestreckt darin hättest liegen sehn können, als waren sie hohle Schäfte von Palmbäumen.
null.verse 69:8: Siehst du von ihnen einen übrig?
null.verse 69:9: Und Pharao und die vor ihm waren und die umgestürzten Städte waren großen Frevels schuldig;
null.verse 69:10: Und sie waren widerspenstig gegen den Gesandten ihres Herrn, darum erfaßte Er sie mit drosselndem Griff.
null.verse 69:11: Siehe, als die Wasser schwollen, da trugen Wir euch in der Arche,
